the feathers are pointing towards the head end line up the 14 stitches making up the top edge of the wing with the next 14 scs of the body as shown in photo 1 and pin into place 1 2 in each of the next 14 stitches single_crochet through both the body and the wing piece as shown in photo 2 if you don t want to weave in the ends later tuck them inside the body now now complete the round in the remaining 5 stitches single_crochet 3 increase sc1 26 stitches in round flip the wings over so that they are facing the right direction they should 3 4 look like photo 4 if the wings get in the way while you are working the next few rounds just flip them back temporarily round 10 single_crochet 1 increase single_crochet 22 increase single_crochet 1 28 round 11 single_crochet around 28 round 12 single_crochet around make a shift stitch 28 in round 13 you ll attach the wings to the body at 3 points warning this can be fiddly if this step causes problems omit it and follow the round 13 instructions from option 1 instead you can then sew the wings into place after finishing the body 8 round 13 single_crochet 1 decrease single_crochet 2 pull up a big loop then put the hook through the wing at the point where the shoulder meets the feathers put the hook through the next single_crochet of the body tighten the loop again and make a single_crochet to hold the wing in position see put the hook through the next single_crochet of the body and make a single_crochet to hold the wing in position as shown in photos 3 and 4 continue the round single_crochet in the next 8 stitches of
